page.title: 10Education
page.content: The children who live in this block attend Auchencairn Primary School. This is a two teacher rural school which at present has a roll of twenty-five. The school is well equipped with a computer, disc-drive and printer, colour TV, thermal copier, spirit duplicator, video-recorder and a radio casette recorder. Over the past ten years the school roll has dropped from 50 children to the presen 25. The school building is over 100 years old but modernised in the 1960's. The staff consists of the Headteacher with Primary Four to Primary Seven classes and the Infant teacher who has Primary One to Three. The school meals are cooked on the premises by the School cook.
